title: Gang violence surges at young offenders' centre despite fewer inmates
text:
Gang violence at a notorious young offenders’ institution has risen despite a big fall in the number of teenage inmates, the chief inspector of prisons has revealed.

Peter Clark said the institution was dangerous and unsafe with a 45 per cent rise in violent incidents in just six months even though the number of children held had fallen from 148 to 108.

The number of assaults against staff, including some described as "very serious", soared by around 150 per cent, while levels of self-harm tripled and were 14 times higher than in 2017.
